author: gregthegreek
content: in the custody game - is `hash()` sha256?

author: protolambda
content:
> Is there a rational primer for the constants?
Justin Drake was working on something like this, and put most of the constants in himself. Ask in the general chat, he's on telegram only, and this chat is not bridged.

> in the custody game - is hash() sha256?
Yes. But beware, `Hash()` is an empty bytes32 (all zero). Whereas `hash(input)` is a SHA-256 call. I think they are in the process of changing it, it's an unfortunate side-effect of naming the type

<@322222239850168331>
